pullRequest.title: UR web app project structure created

commit.message: UR web app project structure created

nodes.bodyText: why don't these colours have names? As a someone else looking at this code I don't know what I'm looking at.
Use css variables instead of hex codes throughout.
Use separate files instead
These text class names contain no information on how they should be used. Please file a bug to come back and refactor them to include words that show how they should be used.
We should be able to target es6 right?

nodes.bodyText:
please describe each stage. Stage1 and Stage 2 do not clarify what is happening at each stage.
nit: add space after #

why is everything marked with important!?
Also ideally you should variables to make rebranding in future easier.
in fact what you have here is pure css, you are not using any of the advantages of sass as far as I can see; if you plan to use pure css, don't import sass as an additional dependency.

important! should only be used when overruling an existing rule.
For a brand new application, it should not be needed at all; you should instead create well defined selector rules.
Also when you add it to every single rule, it becomes useless when you actually need it.
some general rules for css specificity to consider: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Specificity

nit: indentation should be fixed to match our xml styleguide.
Also + is blue where as delete and edit are black, is that a design decision?

+
+/** *************************************************************************************************

nodes.bodyText: Just to clarify, I meant color: var(--blue), not just in the class names.

Since I can't see the future HTML using these styles it's hard to say, but just using more specific selectors should help. I would go down the @mixin route to have general "utility" styles apply to specific elements.
Font sizes should be relative units, i.e. % or em/rem, to improve accessibility
Looking at current browser usage I don't think there's a strong case for not supporting es6 natively.

nodes.bodyText: Use lowercase for variable names.
-webkit-box is replaced by flexbox.
typo, too many dashes.
relative size should be used for line-height too.
Some of these colour names don't help very much. Please use more descriptive names than the HTML names.
This is very similar to "cinnabar". It's usually better to use the SCSS tint functions like darken and lighten to create a unified palette around a few colours.

Quoted properties shouldn't be used except for consistency within a single object where you need to use it with at least one name, i.e. just because the keys of rules are quoted doesn't mean these should be.
All colours should be together, ideally in a _colors.scss file.

commit.message: code review comments has been resolved
